_comment: Created by EFisher on 03/12/2015 13:07:02 using v2.7
title: Why are patients exiting drug treatment and how has this changed?
analysis_commentary: Individuals who achieve completion of drug treatment demonstrate a significant improvement in health and wellbeing in terms of increased longevity, reduced blood-borne virus transmission, improved parenting skills and improved physical and psychological health. The proportion of service users who completed drug treatment free of dependency increased to 47% in 2011/12, from 38% in 2009/10, where it has subsequently remained stable.
data_source: Public Health England, National Drug Treatment Monitoring System
